item.title: Cryostation v1.1.6.13
item.description:
Product: Cryostation v1.1.6.13
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 03 Feb 2021 15:01:22 -0500

Description: Program for logging Montana Instruments Cryostation status to the DSC. Provides a UI and API for getting information from the Cryostation.

Release Notes: [1.1.5]
- Update to Instrument v1.8.1
- Update port number (55446)
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Razorbill RP100 v1.2.1.5
item.description:
Product: Razorbill RP100 v1.2.1.5
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Tue, 02 Feb 2021 18:20:29 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Divers for Razorbill RP100 HV amplifier

Release Notes: [1.2.1.5]
- Issue #1: Add RST method
- Issue #2: Calling Source V1(2) or Set Strain always enables output
- Issue #3: Add Error case structure to all methods
- Add VISA RW subVI to handle VISA read and write. Can be used to send arbitrary commands, for example for debugging, checking errors
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: PPMS Monitor and Control v1.7.0.45
item.description:
Product: PPMS Monitor and Control v1.7.0.45
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Tue, 02 Feb 2021 16:27:57 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Program for logging PPMS status to the DSC. Provides a UI and API for controlling the magnet field, temperature, and rotator angle (for PPM2)

Release Notes: [1.7.0]
- Add support for PPMS3 and simulated PPMS (Must install MultiVu Simulation Mode and QD Instrument Server)
- Major reorganization of project hierarchy
- Update to latest Instrument Framework (v1.8.1)
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.8.1.97
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.8.1.97
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Tue, 02 Feb 2021 13:47:03 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Method for communicate with a piece of hardware (provides a hardware abstraction layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either National Instruments' Simple Messaging Library (STM) or cross-platform protocol 0MQ)
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

The LevyLab Instrument Framework makes extensive use of JKI State Machines and JKI State Machine Objects.z

Release Notes: [1.8.1]
**updating will require changing your instrument projects**
- Fix Issues #29, #30, #31
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.8.0.96
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.8.0.96
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Fri, 29 Jan 2021 14:50:33 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Method for communicate with a piece of hardware (provides a hardware abstraction layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either National Instruments' Simple Messaging Library (STM) or cross-platform protocol 0MQ)
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

The LevyLab Instrument Framework makes extensive use of JKI State Machines and JKI State Machine Objects.z

Release Notes: [1.8.0]
**updating will require changing your instrument projects**
- Remove support for Logger.DSC
- Change class private data organization (incl. references to DSC)
- Enable ZMQ RC type (Call Write RC Type to set)
- Change Instrument: Remote Client.vi
- Change RC.Remote Client.vi
- Update some test routines
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: XY Utilities v1.3.2.16
item.description:
Product: XY Utilities v1.3.2.16
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Mon, 11 Jan 2021 14:51:23 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Utilities for working with XY-data type (Cluster of 1D X and Y arrays).

Supported methods:
- <b>Arithmetic</b>: Add, Subtract, Multiply, Divide, Square
- <b>Array</b>: Sort, Reverse, Decimate, Decimate Array, Subset, Swap X and Y, Get X and Y, Append, Restrict X Range, Remove Outliers
- <b>Signal Processing</b>: Derivative, Average, Moving Average, Interpolate, Interpolate Parameter, Resample, FFT Spectrum, FFT Power Spectrum, Symmetrize
- <b>Filters</b>: Zero Phase Low Pass, Savitsky-Golay,
- <b>Conversion</b>: Waveform to XY, XY to Waveform, 2D to XY, XY to 2D

Release Notes: New Methods

Changes
- Change Difference Quotient.vi Algorithm
- Add Pointers to Sort.vi

Bug Fixes
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: XY Utilities v1.3.0.14
item.description:
Product: XY Utilities v1.3.0.14
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 08 Jan 2021 12:13:13 -0500
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Utilities for working with XY-data type (Cluster of 1D X and Y arrays).

Supported methods:
- <b>Arithmetic</b>: Add, Subtract, Multiply, Divide, Square
- <b>Array</b>: Sort, Reverse, Decimate, Decimate Array, Subset, Swap X and Y, Get X and Y, Append, Restrict X Range, Remove Outliers
- <b>Signal Processing</b>: Derivative, Average, Moving Average, Interpolate, Interpolate Parameter, Resample, FFT Spectrum, FFT Power Spectrum, Symmetrize
- <b>Filters</b>: Zero Phase Low Pass, Savitsky-Golay,
- <b>Conversion</b>: Waveform to XY, XY to Waveform, 2D to XY, XY to 2D

Release Notes: New Methods
- Linear Fit.vi: Linear LS Fit with upper and lower bounds
- Difference Quotient.vi: Returns average of forward and reverse difference quotient centered within window

Changes
- Interpolate now uses Interpolate 1D Array.vi instead of Interpolate.vi
- Change the way Derivative.vi automatically calculates "dx" from X-Array
item.dc:creator: LevyLab
